subject: Music
title: Why the Brain Loves Music
description: One-minute skill: Why the Brain Loves Music.

hook.text: No other species cries at a melody. The human brain is wired for music.

buildup.text: Music activates more brain regions simultaneously than almost any other activity.

discovery.text: Listening to music engages auditory, motor, emotional, and memory systems all at once.

twist.text: There's no single music center â€” the whole brain participates in the experience.

climax.text: Even imagining music activates auditory cortex as if you were actually hearing it.

punchline.text: Music doesn't just enter the brain. It lights it up.

quiz.question: How does music affect the brain?
options: It activates multiple brain regions simultaneously
It only activates the auditory cortex
It puts the brain to sleep
